tests.title: HTML Basics

questions.text: What does HTML stand for?

Which HTML element is used to specify a header for a document or section?
What is the correct HTML for creating a checkbox?
What is the correct HTML for making a text input field?
Which HTML5 element is used to display a scalar measurement within a range?

tests.description: Test your knowledge of CSS styling concepts

questions.text: What does CSS stand for?

How do you select an element with id 'demo'?

How do you display hyperlinks without an underline?
Which property is used to change the font of an element?
How do you make a list that lists its items with squares?
What is the default value of the position property?
Which CSS property is used to specify the transparency of an element?
Which CSS property allows you to specify a shadow effect to a text?

tests.description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript programming

questions.text: Inside which HTML element do we put the JavaScript?

How to write an IF statement in JavaScript?
How do you declare a JavaScript variable?

What will the following code return: Boolean(10 > 9)

tests.title: React Fundamentals
tests.description: Test your knowledge of React.js framework

questions.text: What is React?
options: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

questions.text: What is JSX in React?
What function is used to update state in a React function component?
What are props in React?
Which hook is used for side-effects in function components?
What does the React.Fragment component do?
options: Adds a visible container around elements
Allows returning multiple elements without a wrapper

questions.text: What is the virtual DOM in React?
options: A special browser feature for React
A lightweight copy of the actual DOM
A database for storing component states

questions.text: What lifecycle method is called after a component renders?
How can you prevent a component from rendering in React?
options: Return null from the render method

questions.text: What is the purpose of keys in React lists?
options: To help React identify changed items

tests.title: Node.js and Express
tests.description: Test your knowledge of Node.js and Express framework

questions.text: What is Node.js?
options: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine

questions.text: What is Express.js?
options: A minimal web framework for Node.js

questions.text: Which method is used to start a Node.js server listening for connections?
What does the package.json file contain?
How do you install express module in Node.js?
Which of the following is middleware in Express?
options: A function with access to request and response objects

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'body-parser' package in Express?
Which Express method is used to handle GET requests?
How do you access URL parameters in Express?
What is Node.js event loop?
options: A UI component for handling user events
A mechanism to handle asynchronous operations

categories.name: Programming Languages
categories.description: Tests covering various programming languages and paradigms

tests.title: Java Fundamentals
tests.description: Test your knowledge of Java programming language

questions.text: What is Java?
Which of the following is not a Java feature?
Which statement is true about Java?
options: Java is a sequence-dependent programming language
Java is a code-dependent programming language
Java is a platform-dependent programming language
Java is a platform-independent programming language

questions.text: Which component is used to compile, debug and execute Java programs?
Which of these keywords is used to define interfaces in Java?
Which of the following is a valid declaration of a char?
What is the return type of the main method in Java?
Which exception is thrown when java is out of memory?
Which of these methods of the String class can be used to compare two String objects for their equality?
In Java, a method declared with the _______ keyword can't be overridden.

tests.title: C++ Programming
tests.description: Test your knowledge of C++ programming language

questions.text: Which of the following is one of the advantages of C++?
Which of the following is the correct syntax for including a user defined header file in C++?
Which of the following is the correct operator to access members of a class through a pointer?
What is the default access modifier for members of a class?
What is the correct way to define a constant in C++?
Which operator is used for dynamic memory allocation in C++?
What is polymorphism in C++?
options: The ability to take multiple forms

questions.text: What is the purpose of a virtual function in C++?
options: To allow derived classes to override the function
To create multiple instances of a function

questions.text: Which concept is used to implement run time polymorphism in C++?
What is a destructor in C++?
options: A special member function that constructs objects
A special member function that destroys objects
A function that deletes the class definition
A function that prevents memory leaks

tests.title: JavaScript Advanced
tests.description: Test your knowledge of advanced JavaScript concepts

questions.text: What is the difference between '==' and '===' operators in JavaScript?
options: '==' checks value, '===' checks value and type
'===' checks value, '==' checks value and type
There is no '===' operator in JavaScript

questions.text: Which JavaScript method is used to remove the last element from an array and returns that element?
What does the 'this' keyword refer to in JavaScript?
options: It always refers to the window object
It always refers to the global object
It refers to the object that the function is a property of
It refers to the parent object in the DOM tree

questions.text: Which of the following is a JavaScript promise state?
What is closure in JavaScript?
options: A way to protect variables from modifications
A function with access to variables from an outer function scope
A method to close browser windows
A technique to prevent memory leaks

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'use strict' directive in JavaScript?
options: To tell the browser to use the latest version of JavaScript
To enable strict mode that catches common coding mistakes
To make JavaScript code run faster
To allow the use of new JavaScript features

questions.text: What is a JavaScript generator function?
options: A function that creates other functions
A function that can be paused and resumed
A function that generates random numbers

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'map' method in JavaScript?
options: To map one array to another
To create a new array with the results of calling a function on every element
To search for an element in an array

questions.text: What is event bubbling in JavaScript?
options: A way to create new events
A technique to handle events efficiently
The propagation of events from child element to parent element
A method to prevent default browser behavior

questions.text: What are JavaScript Promises used for?
options: To make performance promises to the browser
To define functions that run periodically

questions.text: What is Python?
Which of the following is the correct way to comment multiple lines in Python?
What is the output of print(type([]))?
How do you create a list comprehension in Python?
What is the correct way to define a function in Python?
What does the 'self' parameter in a class method refer to?
options: The current instance of the class

questions.text: Which of the following is used to handle exceptions in Python?
What is the purpose of '__init__' in Python classes?
What does the 'yield' keyword do in Python?
options: It pauses a function and returns a value

questions.text: What is PEP 8 in Python?
options: A style guide for Python code

categories.name: CS Fundamentals
categories.description: Tests covering fundamental computer science concepts

tests.title: Operating Systems
tests.description: Test your knowledge of operating system concepts

questions.text: What is an operating system?
Which of the following is not an operating system?
What is the purpose of a kernel in an operating system?
options: To manage core operations of the computer

questions.text: Which scheduling algorithm is based on the concept of time quantum?
What is a deadlock in operating systems?
options: When a process is terminated unexpectedly
When two or more processes are unable to proceed because each is waiting for resources held by others

questions.text: What is thrashing in operating systems?
options: When the CPU utilization is very high
When a process is consuming too much memory
When the system spends more time swapping pages than executing instructions
When multiple processes are competing for CPU time

questions.text: What is virtual memory?
options: A technique that allows execution of processes that may not be completely in memory
A memory that exists only in the cache

questions.text: What is the purpose of paging in operating systems?
options: To increase the speed of the processor
To manage memory by dividing it into fixed-size blocks

questions.text: Which of the following is not a process state?
What is a semaphore in operating systems?

tests.title: Object-Oriented Programming
tests.description: Test your knowledge of OOP concepts

questions.text: What is Object-Oriented Programming?
options: A programming paradigm based on mathematical functions
A programming paradigm based on objects and classes

questions.text: Which of the following is not a principle of OOP?
What is encapsulation in OOP?
options: The ability of a class to take multiple forms
The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data
The ability to create new classes from existing ones

questions.text: What is inheritance in OOP?
options: The ability to hide implementation details
The concept that objects should communicate via messages
The mechanism by which one class acquires properties of another class

questions.text: What is polymorphism in OOP?
options: The ability of an object to take on many forms
The process of hiding implementation details
The mechanism to create new classes

questions.text: What is abstraction in OOP?
options: The concept of hiding implementation details and showing only functionality
The ability to create new classes from existing ones
The concept that everything is an object

questions.text: What is a constructor in OOP?
options: A special method that is called when an object is created

questions.text: What is method overloading?
options: Having multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
Hiding a method in a subclass
Creating a new instance of a method

questions.text: What is method overriding?
options: Creating a new instance of a method
Having multiple methods with the same name but different parameters
Providing a new implementation for a method already defined in a superclass
Hiding a method in a subclass

questions.text: What is a class in OOP?
options: A template or blueprint for creating objects

tests.title: Computer Networks
tests.description: Test your knowledge of computer networking concepts

questions.text: What is a computer network?
options: A collection of computers in a room
A set of computers connected to share resources
A group of computers made by the same manufacturer
A system that connects to the internet

questions.text: Which network topology has a central node to which all other nodes are connected?
What is the purpose of a router in a network?
options: To connect devices within the same network

questions.text: Which of the following is not a layer in the OSI model?
What is the purpose of DNS in networking?
options: To translate domain names to IP addresses

questions.text: What does HTTP stand for?
Which protocol is used for secure web browsing?
What is the function of DHCP in networking?
options: To translate domain names to IP addresses
To dynamically assign IP addresses to devices

questions.text: Which of the following is not a network protocol?
What is a subnet mask used for?
options: To identify the network portion of an IP address

tests.title: Computer Architecture
tests.description: Test your knowledge of computer architecture concepts

questions.text: What is a CPU?
What is the purpose of the ALU in a CPU?
options: To control the flow of data
To perform arithmetic and logical operations

questions.text: What is a cache memory?
options: A small, fast memory used to improve CPU performance
A memory used for backing up data
A memory used for storing graphics

questions.text: What is pipelining in computer architecture?
options: A method of connecting computers in a network
A technique to increase processor throughput by executing multiple instructions simultaneously
A way to store data on hard disks
A technique to cool the CPU

questions.text: What is the purpose of the control unit in a CPU?
options: To direct the operation of the processor

questions.text: What is the difference between RISC and CISC?
options: RISC uses complex instructions while CISC uses simple instructions
RISC uses simple instructions while CISC uses complex instructions
RISC uses more memory than CISC

questions.text: What is a register in CPU?
options: A device that regulates power supply
A small, high-speed storage area within the CPU
A type of memory that stores the operating system
A device that counts clock cycles

questions.text: What is a bus in computer architecture?
options: A software component that manages data flow
A communication system that transfers data between components
A cooling system for the CPU

questions.text: What is the purpose of the memory management unit (MMU)?
options: To manage the allocation of RAM
To translate virtual addresses to physical addresses
To control the flow of data in the CPU

questions.text: What is the von Neumann architecture?
options: A computer design where program and data are stored in the same memory
A computer design with multiple processors
A computer design where program and data are stored in separate memories
A computer design focused on parallel processing

tests.title: Database Management Systems
tests.description: Test your knowledge of DBMS and SQL concepts

questions.text: What is a database?
What is a primary key?
options: The first column in a table
A column that can contain NULL values
A column or set of columns that uniquely identifies each row in a table
A key used to encrypt data

questions.text: What is normalization in DBMS?
options: A process to make data case-sensitive
A process to organize data to reduce redundancy

questions.text: What is SQL?
Which SQL command is used to create a new table?
Which SQL clause is used to filter records?
What is a foreign key?
options: A key used in other countries
A primary key in another table
A key that references a column in another table
A key used to encrypt foreign data

questions.text: What does ACID stand for in the context of databases?
Which SQL command is used to update data in a database?
What is the purpose of the SQL JOIN clause?
options: To combine rows from two or more tables

categories.name: Aptitude
categories.description: Tests covering various aptitude and reasoning skills

questions.text: If a shirt costs $45 after a 25% discount, what was the original price?
A car travels at 60 km/h for the first half of a journey and at 40 km/h for the second half. What is the average speed for the entire journey?
If 8 workers can complete a task in 6 days, how many days would it take 12 workers to complete the same task?
What is the next number in the sequence: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
A pipe can fill a tank in 6 hours. Another pipe can empty the tank in 12 hours. If both pipes are open, how long will it take to fill the tank?
If a rectangular field has a length of 24 meters and a width of 18 meters, what is its area?
If a number is increased by 20% and then decreased by 20%, the final value is what percentage of the original?
A train travels at a speed of 72 km/h. How many meters does it travel in 15 seconds?
If the ratio of boys to girls in a class is 4:5 and there are 36 students in total, how many boys are there?
What is the simple interest on $1,500 at 4.5% per annum for 3 years?

tests.title: Logical Reasoning
tests.description: Test your logical reasoning and problem-solving skills

questions.text: If all Zips are Zaps, and all Zaps are Zops, then:
Complete the series: 3, 6, 11, 18, 27, ?
If CAT is coded as 312, how would DOG be coded?
A is B's sister. C is B's mother. D is C's father. E is D's mother. How is A related to D?
If FRIEND is coded as HUMJTK, how would CANDLE be coded?
In a row of children, Ram is 7th from the left and Shyam is 9th from the right. If they interchange their positions, Ram becomes 22nd from the left. How many children are there in the row?
Select the odd one out: Lion, Tiger, Elephant, Leopard, Cheetah
If it is Monday today, what day will it be after 61 days?
A clock shows 8:30. What is the angle between the hour and minute hands?
Which of the following does not belong to the group? MLK, JIH, GFE, CDE, BAZ

tests.title: Verbal Reasoning
tests.description: Test your verbal reasoning and language skills

questions.text: Choose the word that is a synonym of 'BENEVOLENT':
Choose the word that is an antonym of 'FRUGAL':
Complete the analogy: Book is to Reading as Fork is to _______:
Choose the word that does not belong: Stapler, Pen, Paper, Marker, Banana
If 'pink' means 'blue', 'blue' means 'white', 'white' means 'black', and 'black' means 'red', what is the color of milk?
Select the pair of words with a relationship most similar to: ARTIFACT : ARCHEOLOGIST
Choose the option that best completes the sentence: The politician's speech was so _______ that even his supporters had difficulty understanding it.
Find the odd one out: Copper, Tin, Iron, Steel, Zinc
If FRIEND = 6 and ENEMY = 5, then ACQUAINTANCE = ?
Select the word that means the same as 'PROCRASTINATE':
